KH.content: khōra as myth w/in myth, inscribed for a moment, while having a bearing on the place of inscription, oneiric, bastard reading, heterogenous to philosopho-mytheme which orders myth to its philosophical telos
KH.linkedContent: khōra as myth w/in myth, inscribed for a moment, while having a bearing on the place of inscription, oneiric, bastard reading, heterogenous to philosopho-mytheme which orders myth to its philosophical telos

AF.content: the 3 condensed meanings of word “impression”: 1. scriptural or typographic: mark on surface, on substrate, Freud’s Mystic Pad, difference btwn Verdrängung and Unterdrückung 2. “Freudian impression” of the archive, opposed to rigor of concept, “archive” only a notion [in psychoanlaysis], one not destined to some sin of nominalism but the possibility & future of the concept, very concept of the future 3. “Freudian impression” left by Sigmund Freud on himself, and on anyone who speaks about him, to be marked by Freud w/out knowing it
AF.linkedContent: the 3 condensed meanings of word “impression”: 1. scriptural or typographic: mark on surface, on substrate, Freud’s Mystic Pad, difference btwn Verdrängung and Unterdrückung 2. “Freudian impression” of the archive, opposed to rigor of concept, “archive” only a notion [in psychoanlaysis], one not destined to some sin of nominalism but the possibility & future of the concept, very concept of the future 3. “Freudian impression” left by Sigmund Freud on himself, and on anyone who speaks about him, to be marked by Freud w/out knowing it

SPOM.content: “mystical character” of commodity is inscribed before being inscribed, traced before being written letter for letter, everything begins before it begins > but Marx wants to know the instant the ghost comes on stage—this is a manner of exorcism
SPOM.linkedContent: “mystical character” of commodity is inscribed before being inscribed, traced before being written letter for letter, everything begins before it begins > but Marx wants to know the instant the ghost comes on stage—this is a manner of exorcism

POOF.content: hexis binds 2x in same time, such contretemporality another name for psukhé, accounts for, registers, l’épreuve du temps, withholds (en garder) its trace in the body [by way of inscription] > the yoke effect
POOF.linkedContent: hexis binds 2x in same time, such contretemporality another name for psukhé, accounts for, registers, l’épreuve du temps, withholds (en garder) its trace in the body [by way of inscription] > the yoke effect

POOF.content: friendship can never elude rhetoric of epitáphios, transfixed celebration of spectrality, at once fervent & caught in petrified cold of its inscription (funeral speech, testamentary fervor of heir)
POOF.linkedContent: friendship can never elude rhetoric of epitáphios, transfixed celebration of spectrality, at once fervent & caught in petrified cold of its inscription (funeral speech, testamentary fervor of heir)

POOF.content: we can’t exclude fact that when someone speaks they strive not to be understood, diabolical figure of death drive > so can the accord of hyperbolic lovence be possible, hoping to be understood beyond all dialectics, haunting (failure) must leave an imprint on the body it seems to threaten, merging indissociably, it’s impossible not to aspire to this haunting [a necessity]: instant of decision remains heterogenous, undecidable, crucial experience of perhaps
POOF.linkedContent: we can’t exclude fact that when someone speaks they strive not to be understood, diabolical figure of death drive > so can the accord of hyperbolic lovence be possible, hoping to be understood beyond all dialectics, haunting (failure) must leave an imprint on the body it seems to threaten, merging indissociably, it’s impossible not to aspire to this haunting [a necessity]: instant of decision remains heterogenous, undecidable, crucial experience of perhaps

MPM.content: inscription of memory effaces interiorizing recollection, not because of external limit or finite limitation of memory, but because of [allegorical] structure of relation to Other
MPM.linkedContent: inscription of memory effaces interiorizing recollection, not because of external limit or finite limitation of memory, but because of [allegorical] structure of relation to Other

MSUBJ.content: to speak of the subjectile, we must speak by insertion and precipitation, acceleration of rhythmical projection [see MPM p. 62] and inscription of projectile, beyond “words and images”
MSUBJ.linkedContent: to speak of the subjectile, we must speak by insertion and precipitation, acceleration of rhythmical projection [see MPM p. 62] and inscription of projectile, beyond “words and images”

VM.content: structure [inside-outside] has no meaning w/out included origin, inscribed eastern horizon which is neither w/in nor w/out space
VM.linkedContent: structure [inside-outside] has no meaning w/out included origin, inscribed eastern horizon which is neither w/in nor w/out space

VM.content: in classical infinitism (Descartes) neutralization of space to liberate positive infinity, body: exteriority, zero point, origin of space, an origin which has no meaning w/out of, origin inseparable from genitivity, from space it engenders/orients, an inscribed origin, written, traced
VM.linkedContent: in classical infinitism (Descartes) neutralization of space to liberate positive infinity, body: exteriority, zero point, origin of space, an origin which has no meaning w/out of, origin inseparable from genitivity, from space it engenders/orients, an inscribed origin, written, traced

PP.content: an inscription, Delphikon gramma [Phaedrus (229d)], anything but oracle, prescribes silent cipher, signifies, orders autoscopy, autognosis [re: Socrates’ send-off of myths]
PP.linkedContent: an inscription, Delphikon gramma [Phaedrus (229d)], anything but oracle, prescribes silent cipher, signifies, orders autoscopy, autognosis [re: Socrates’ send-off of myths]

PP.content: soul-inscription, inscription of truth in soul, uses a metaphor [Plato admits it] that philosophy will never be able to do w/out, must borrow from simulacrum; metaphoricity is logic of contamination, contamination of logic
PP.linkedContent: soul-inscription, inscription of truth in soul, uses a metaphor [Plato admits it] that philosophy will never be able to do w/out, must borrow from simulacrum; metaphoricity is logic of contamination, contamination of logic

PP.content: good writing can only be described through metaphor of the bad
PP.linkedContent: good writing can only be described through metaphor of the bad

PP.content: origin of the world as a trace, a receptacle, womb, matrix, w/out any form of presence or presence of form, because this would be an inscription w/in the mother
PP.linkedContent: origin of the world as a trace, a receptacle, womb, matrix, w/out any form of presence or presence of form, because this would be an inscription w/in the mother

PP.content: “Plato’s metaphors”? passage beyond all “Platonic” oppositions, toward aporia of originary inscription
PP.linkedContent: “Plato’s metaphors”? passage beyond all “Platonic” oppositions, toward aporia of originary inscription

PP.content: la khōra est grosse de tout ce qui se dissémine ici, inscription produces the son and at the same time the constitution of structurality
PP.linkedContent: la khōra est grosse de tout ce qui se dissémine ici, inscription produces the son and at the same time the constitution of structurality

FSW.content: when breaching, breaking of path, becomes route (via rupta) opened in nature, in wood (hyle) [see p. 229] > violent inscription of form opposed to writing, route acquires reversibility in time & space
FSW.linkedContent: when breaching, breaking of path, becomes route (via rupta) opened in nature, in wood (hyle) [see p. 229] > violent inscription of form opposed to writing, route acquires reversibility in time & space

FSW.content: traces produce space of their inscription by acceding to period of their erasure, traces constituted by double force of repetition & erasure, of legibility & illegibility
FSW.linkedContent: traces produce space of their inscription by acceding to period of their erasure, traces constituted by double force of repetition & erasure, of legibility & illegibility

SH.content: inscription breaks silence of pure singularity
date consumed from w/in, the expiring that is its production, genesis, inscription: its essence & chance
SH.linkedContent: date consumed from w/in, the expiring that is its production, genesis, inscription: its essence & chance

ATIA.content: Derrida substituted trace for signifier to ensure that erasure and inscription could be included in the same structure
ATIA.linkedContent: Derrida substituted trace for signifier to ensure that erasure and inscription could be included in the same structure

FS.content: doesn’t pure speech require inscription, isn’t it a privileged representation of inscription? just like Leibniz’s essence requires existence (pushes out toward world), power <small>></small> act?
FS.linkedContent: doesn’t pure speech require inscription, isn’t it a privileged representation of inscription? just like Leibniz’s essence requires existence (pushes out toward world), power > act?

FS.content: to write: 1) not only to conceive Leibnizian book as an impossible possibility (as Mallarmé names the limit) 2) ce n'est pas seulement savoir que le Livre n'existe pas et qu'à jamais il y a des livres où (se) brise, avant même d'avoir été un, le sens d'un monde impensé par un sujet absolu [the English translation of this sentence fails to capture the sense of the books themselves shattering] 3) nor is it to have lost the certainty of pages binding themselves into a “book of reason” 4) not only to know that the non-written can’t be relegated to having no basis by the obliging negativity of some dialectic 5) not only to know that through writing the best may not transpire 6) it is the impossibility of making meaning precede writing: it is to lower meaning while elevating inscription
FS.linkedContent: to write: 1) not only to conceive Leibnizian book as an impossible possibility (as Mallarmé names the limit) 2) ce n'est pas seulement savoir que le Livre n'existe pas et qu'à jamais il y a des livres où (se) brise, avant même d'avoir été un, le sens d'un monde impensé par un sujet absolu [the English translation of this sentence fails to capture the sense of the books themselves shattering] 3) nor is it to have lost the certainty of pages binding themselves into a “book of reason” 4) not only to know that the non-written can’t be relegated to having no basis by the obliging negativity of some dialectic 5) not only to know that through writing the best may not transpire 6) it is the impossibility of making meaning precede writing: it is to lower meaning while elevating inscription

FS.content: writing, moment of depth as decay > original valley of the other w/in Being; incidence & insistence of inscription
FS.linkedContent: writing, moment of depth as decay > original valley of the other w/in Being; incidence & insistence of inscription

DIF.content: trace: à la fois, monument & mirage, traced & erased, living & dead, living in its simulation of life’s preserved inscription: a pyramid, to be deciphered otherwise, text w/out voice
DIF.linkedContent: trace: à la fois, monument & mirage, traced & erased, living & dead, living in its simulation of life’s preserved inscription: a pyramid, to be deciphered otherwise, text w/out voice

O.content: differance inscribes contradictions, is the critical limit of idealizing powers of la relève (Aufgehoben), which reduces contradictions to homogeneity of single model
O.linkedContent: differance inscribes contradictions, is the critical limit of idealizing powers of la relève (Aufgehoben), which reduces contradictions to homogeneity of single model

O.content: preface’s (double inscription’s) semantic envelopment in Book (representative of ontotheology, absolute knowledge) > restance (left-overness) of its textual exteriority should not be confused w/ Book’s physical thickness
O.linkedContent: preface’s (double inscription’s) semantic envelopment in Book (representative of ontotheology, absolute knowledge) > restance (left-overness) of its textual exteriority should not be confused w/ Book’s physical thickness

O.content: “la dissémination (se) produit (dans) cela : coupe de plaisir” > il rythme et le plaisir et la répétition selon une coupe multiple > il [text, literature, the beyond of the whole] imprime pourtant au tout, depuis le “dedans” du système où il marque ses effets de colonne vide et inscrite, un mouvement de fiction
O.linkedContent: “la dissémination (se) produit (dans) cela : coupe de plaisir” > il rythme et le plaisir et la répétition selon une coupe multiple > il [text, literature, the beyond of the whole] imprime pourtant au tout, depuis le “dedans” du système où il marque ses effets de colonne vide et inscrite, un mouvement de fiction

DPi.content: memory/archivization engage suffering body in a machine, technical repetition, Mnemoteknik, must cause suffering, red of fire before red of blood > for N., punishment is not juridical: it’s a movement of life, writing to remember, inscription, imprint past in body
DPi.linkedContent: memory/archivization engage suffering body in a machine, technical repetition, Mnemoteknik, must cause suffering, red of fire before red of blood > for N., punishment is not juridical: it’s a movement of life, writing to remember, inscription, imprint past in body

RGE.content: can one inscribe in lexicon/syntax of a language, our language (of philosophy), that which exceeds opposition of concepts governed by this communal logic?
RGE.linkedContent: can one inscribe in lexicon/syntax of a language, our language (of philosophy), that which exceeds opposition of concepts governed by this communal logic?

RGE.content: by interpreting negativity as labor, by betting for discourse/meaning/history, Hegel bet against play, chance, blinded himself to what made his own bet possible > each stage through spirit (each suspension of play) was a phase of play: play includes work of meaning (meaning of work) not in terms of knowledge but in terms of inscription: meaning inscribed in meaningless play
RGE.linkedContent: by interpreting negativity as labor, by betting for discourse/meaning/history, Hegel bet against play, chance, blinded himself to what made his own bet possible > each stage through spirit (each suspension of play) was a phase of play: play includes work of meaning (meaning of work) not in terms of knowledge but in terms of inscription: meaning inscribed in meaningless play

RGE.content: general economy does not overturn but comprehends (not by way of knowledge-gathering but by inscribing w/in its opening) absolute knowledge, folds its figures into nonbasis of expenditure, relates them to destruction of value > atheology, a-teleology, aneschatology
RGE.linkedContent: general economy does not overturn but comprehends (not by way of knowledge-gathering but by inscribing w/in its opening) absolute knowledge, folds its figures into nonbasis of expenditure, relates them to destruction of value > atheology, a-teleology, aneschatology

RGE.content: a text [Bataille’s] that traces, in silence, structure of the eye [illumination] > in contriving/weaving (tramer) “l’absolu déchirement,” absolutely rends (déchire) its own tissue—once more “solid” and servile de se donner encore à lire
RGE.linkedContent: a text [Bataille’s] that traces, in silence, structure of the eye [illumination] > in contriving/weaving (tramer) “l’absolu déchirement,” absolutely rends (déchire) its own tissue—once more “solid” and servile de se donner encore à lire

Gii.content: Schlag (blow, also race/species in figurative sense) & Geschlecht > Heidegger: our language calls the humanity that has received imprint of striking, or cast in this striking (Schlag), Geschlecht ——das Zwiefache, double, dual duplicitous fold of sexual difference
Gii.linkedContent: Schlag (blow, also race/species in figurative sense) & Geschlecht > Heidegger: our language calls the humanity that has received imprint of striking, or cast in this striking (Schlag), Geschlecht ——das Zwiefache, double, dual duplicitous fold of sexual difference

Gii.content: die Zwietracht der Geschlechter, duality of sexes as dissension, war, disagreement
Gii.linkedContent: die Zwietracht der Geschlechter, duality of sexes as dissension, war, disagreement

DST.content: rhythm: spaced repetition of a percussion, inscriptive force (insensible) of a spacing > doesn’t belong to visible/audible figuration—still structures them (rhythmotypical, typorhythmic)
DST.linkedContent: rhythm: spaced repetition of a percussion, inscriptive force (insensible) of a spacing > doesn’t belong to visible/audible figuration—still structures them (rhythmotypical, typorhythmic)

DST.content: though Heidegger recalled that Georgiades translated rhuthmos as Gepräge (imprint, seal, type, character), this didn’t prevent him from bringing typos back to ontotypology & subject back to epoch of subjectity
DST.linkedContent: though Heidegger recalled that Georgiades translated rhuthmos as Gepräge (imprint, seal, type, character), this didn’t prevent him from bringing typos back to ontotypology & subject back to epoch of subjectity

RM.content: for Heidegger, most grave and engraving signature of decision engages/allies 2 families in German language: 1. Ziehen (Zug, Bezug, Gezüge, durchziehen, entziehen) 2. Reissen (Riss, Aufriss, Umriss, Grundriss, etc.)
RM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, most grave and engraving signature of decision engages/allies 2 families in German language: 1. Ziehen (Zug, Bezug, Gezüge, durchziehen, entziehen) 2. Reissen (Riss, Aufriss, Umriss, Grundriss, etc.)

RM.content: trait (that plural word): possibility of language, logos, lexis, inscription
RM.linkedContent: trait (that plural word): possibility of language, logos, lexis, inscription

RM.content: Being’s inscription n’arrive qu’à s’effacer, cf. differance/trace
RM.linkedContent: Being’s inscription n’arrive qu’à s’effacer, cf. differance/trace

TR.content: plus de faute [no more fault, more fault] > vicious circle of excusing & being guilty
TR.linkedContent: plus de faute [no more fault, more fault] > vicious circle of excusing & being guilty

TR.content: guilt as inscription that is ineffaceable, inexorable, inexonerable
TR.linkedContent: guilt as inscription that is ineffaceable, inexorable, inexonerable

TR.content: not only accusation & judgment in confession, there’s the executioner (carrying out of the sentence): sentence endured in pleasure of writing, ambiguous enjoyment at heart of terrible, severe jubilation of inscription: one steps up to cashier right away to collect interest on a capital that will assume value only “sooner or later,” after my death, in my absence
TR.linkedContent: not only accusation & judgment in confession, there’s the executioner (carrying out of the sentence): sentence endured in pleasure of writing, ambiguous enjoyment at heart of terrible, severe jubilation of inscription: one steps up to cashier right away to collect interest on a capital that will assume value only “sooner or later,” after my death, in my absence

TR.content: confession is always more and/or less guilty (for addressor & addressee) in act of its inscription than the fault being confessed: that confession is never innocent is a first machine, undeniable program
TR.linkedContent: confession is always more and/or less guilty (for addressor & addressee) in act of its inscription than the fault being confessed: that confession is never innocent is a first machine, undeniable program

TR.content: touching on equivocation btwn constative (revealed truth) & performative (the excuse): originary or preoriginary synthesis w/out which there’d be no trace, inscription, body, materiality > it’s why we’re always asking for forgiveness in ambiguous, perjuring mode
TR.linkedContent: touching on equivocation btwn constative (revealed truth) & performative (the excuse): originary or preoriginary synthesis w/out which there’d be no trace, inscription, body, materiality > it’s why we’re always asking for forgiveness in ambiguous, perjuring mode

TR.content: there is the archived event and the archiving event (as inscription): these can be indissociable, contemporary, but not the same thing (structurally)
TR.linkedContent: there is the archived event and the archiving event (as inscription): these can be indissociable, contemporary, but not the same thing (structurally)

TR.content: event of forgiveness: 1) always supposes irreversible interruption, revolutionary caesura, end of history, at least of history as teleological process 2) inscription, material trace
TR.linkedContent: event of forgiveness: 1) always supposes irreversible interruption, revolutionary caesura, end of history, at least of history as teleological process 2) inscription, material trace

TR.content: ribbon: subjectile on which one writes & piece of machine thanks to which one will never have done w/ inscribing [Derrida's deconstructs de Man’s claim “ribbon” is a “free signifier’]
TR.linkedContent: ribbon: subjectile on which one writes & piece of machine thanks to which one will never have done w/ inscribing [Derrida's deconstructs de Man’s claim “ribbon” is a “free signifier’]

WAP.content: double metaphoric of inscription (Plato, Cousin): bad writing (occults, perverts) is cryptic, artificial, secondary, voiceless > must be replaced by good writing
WAP.linkedContent: double metaphoric of inscription (Plato, Cousin): bad writing (occults, perverts) is cryptic, artificial, secondary, voiceless > must be replaced by good writing

D.content: this [re: Numbers] reinscription (writing, a machination) takes place (a lieu), il y a sa violence
D.linkedContent: this [re: Numbers] reinscription (writing, a machination) takes place (a lieu), il y a sa violence

D.content: in scratching (gratter) on this textual matter, your recognize description of a painting, reframed, broken into, placed in another quadrilateral, w/ one side fractured: you are painting, writing while reading: tout le tissu verbal y est pris, et vous avec
D.linkedContent: in scratching (gratter) on this textual matter, your recognize description of a painting, reframed, broken into, placed in another quadrilateral, w/ one side fractured: you are painting, writing while reading: tout le tissu verbal y est pris, et vous avec

LI.content: [Derrida admits to lack of rigor] “engendering” an infinity of new contexts [from SEC] should be replaced by “engendering & inscribing itself,” or being inscribed in > for a context never creates itself ex nihilo, can’t create context on its own, can’t dominate a context either > this limit, finitude, is the condition by which contextual transformations remain possible
LI.linkedContent: [Derrida admits to lack of rigor] “engendering” an infinity of new contexts [from SEC] should be replaced by “engendering & inscribing itself,” or being inscribed in > for a context never creates itself ex nihilo, can’t create context on its own, can’t dominate a context either > this limit, finitude, is the condition by which contextual transformations remain possible

OG.content: writing of difference, fabric (tissu) of trace, permits difference btwn space & time to be articulated in unity of “same” proper body, permits graphic chain to be adapted to a spoken chain > difference is articulation
OG.linkedContent: writing of difference, fabric (tissu) of trace, permits difference btwn space & time to be articulated in unity of “same” proper body, permits graphic chain to be adapted to a spoken chain > difference is articulation

OG.content: that  the “imprint” is irreducible means speech is originarily passive in relation to an absolute past that can never be fully mastered, brought to presence
OG.linkedContent: that the “imprint” is irreducible means speech is originarily passive in relation to an absolute past that can never be fully mastered, brought to presence

OG.content: writing as possibility of road? violent spacing of nature, silva is savage, via rupta is written, form imposed on hylè
OG.linkedContent: writing as possibility of road? violent spacing of nature, silva is savage, via rupta is written, form imposed on hylè

OG.content: imposition of form via spacing, beyond classical model of causality, a new transcendental aesthetic guided by inscription: writing, as Rousseau intuited, linked to nature of social space > inscription as habitation in general
OG.linkedContent: imposition of form via spacing, beyond classical model of causality, a new transcendental aesthetic guided by inscription: writing, as Rousseau intuited, linked to nature of social space > inscription as habitation in general

SPEC.content: inscription of a subject in his [Freud’s] text is also condition of the performance/pertinence of a text, beyond empirical subjectivity, supposing that could exist as soon as one writes, substitutes, supplements: notion of truth incapable of accounting for this performance
SPEC.linkedContent: inscription of a subject in his [Freud’s] text is also condition of the performance/pertinence of a text, beyond empirical subjectivity, supposing that could exist as soon as one writes, substitutes, supplements: notion of truth incapable of accounting for this performance

SPEC.content: death drive: Freud’s “inertia inherent in organic life”
living is differential of force organized by force of inscription [how did Derrida get here?]
SPEC.linkedContent: living is differential of force organized by force of inscription [how did Derrida get here?]

SPEC.content: complex scene of signature in which inscription arrives only to erase itself
SPEC.linkedContent: complex scene of signature in which inscription arrives only to erase itself

FV.content: inscriber/inscribing function not to be confused w/ author > Lacan excludes textual fiction, indicates a general narrative w/in neutralized or naturalized frame, thus overlooks the frame
FV.linkedContent: inscriber/inscribing function not to be confused w/ author > Lacan excludes textual fiction, indicates a general narrative w/in neutralized or naturalized frame, thus overlooks the frame
